title: fanoutqa: In what year did the CEOs of each of the top 5 global companies by revenue begin their term as CEO? (16407610512d6677)

chat_history.content: In what year did the CEOs of each of the top 5 global companies by revenue begin their term as CEO?

function.name: delegate
function.arguments: {"instructions":"Find the top 5 global companies by revenue and the year their current CEOs began their term."}

chat_history.content:
The top 5 global companies by revenue and the years their current CEOs began their terms are as follows:

1. **Walmart**
   - **Revenue**: $611,289 million
   - **CEO**: Doug McMillon (began his term in 2013)

2. **Saudi Aramco**
   - **Revenue**: $603,651 million
   - **CEO**: Amin H. Nasser (began his term in 2015)

3. **State Grid Corporation of China**
   - **Revenue**: $530,009 million
   - **CEO**: Information not found

4. **Amazon**
   - **Revenue**: $513,983 million
   - **CEO**: Andy Jassy (began his term in 2021)

5. **Vitol**
   - **Revenue**: $505,000 million
   - **CEO**: Russell Hardy (began his term in 2018)

For China National Petroleum and Sinopec, the information is as follows:

- **China National Petroleum**
  - **CEO**: Dai Houliang (began his term in 2020)

- **Sinopec**
  - **CEO**: Information not found

If you need more detailed information or further assistance, please let me know!

![](image)Walmart has been the world's largest company by revenue since 2014.[1]
This list comprises the world's largest companies by consolidated revenue, according to the *Fortune* Global 500 2023 rankings and other sources.[2] American retail corporation Walmart has been the world's largest company by revenue since 2014.[1]


The list is limited to the top 50 companies, all of which have annual revenues exceeding US$130 billion. This list is incomplete, as not all companies disclose their information to the media and/or general public.[3]


Out of 50 largest companies 20 are American, 19 Asian and 11 European.[2]




## List[edit]


Information in the list relates to the most recent fiscal year (mostly FY 2022 or 2023)

chat_history.content:
<document>
<title>Dai Houliang</title>
<content>
Chinese businessman

In this Chinese name, the family name is  *Dai*.



| Dai Houliang
 |
| --- |
| 戴厚良
 |
|  |
| Chairman of China National Petroleum Corporation |
| **Incumbent**
 |
| **Assumed office** 17 January 2020 |
| Preceded by | Wang Yilin |
| Chairman of China Petrochemical Corporation |
| **In office**May 2018 – January 2020 |
| Preceded by | Wang Yupu |
| Succeeded by | Zhang Yuzhuo |
|  |
| Personal details |
| Born |  (1963-08-20) 20 August 1963 (age 60)Jiangdu County, Jiangsu, China |
| Political party | Communist Party of China |
| Alma mater | Changzhou University |
|  |


**Dai Houliang** (Chinese: 戴厚良; pinyin: *Dài Hòuliáng*; born 20 August 1963) is a Chinese chemical engineer and business executive currently serving as chairman of China National Petroleum Corporation.[1] He is an alternate member of the 19th CPC Central Committee.




## Biography[edit]


Dai was born in Jiangdu County, Jiangsu, on 20 August 1963. He secondary studied at Dinggou High School (丁沟中学).[2] In July 1981, he was accepted to Changzhou University, where he majored in organic chemical industry.[2] Beginning in 1985, he served in several posts in Yangzi Petrochemical, including deputy general manager, general manager, and chairman. He was appointed deputy financial director of Sinopec, one of the three largest state-owned oil companies in China, in September 2005, becoming vice president in November 2005 and senior vice president and financial director in May 2006. In June 2008, he joined the China Petrochemical Corporation, where he was promoted to general manager in May 2016 and to chairman in May 2018.[3][4] On 17 January 2020, he was appointed chairman of China National Petroleum Corporation, replacing Wang Yilin.[5]



## Honours and awards[edit]


* 2016 State Science and Technology Progress Award (Special Prize) for the development and application of high efficiency and environmental protection aromatics complete set technology[2]
* November 2017 Member of the Chinese Academy of Engineering (CAE)


## References[edit]


1. **^** Xu, Yihe (12 April 2021). "China's CNPC targets renewable energy drive in structural overhaul". *upstreamonline.com*. Retrieved 8 August 2021.
2. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** Wang Xinxin (王心馨) (9 May 2016). 中石化新任总经理戴厚良：曾获国家科学技术进步特等奖. *thepaper.cn* (in Chinese). Retrieved 8 August 2021.
3. **^** "China names Dai Houliang as general manager of Sinopec Group". *reuters.com*. 9 May 2016. Retrieved 8 August 2021.
4. **^** "Dai Houliang named new President of Sinopec Group". *indianchemicalnews.com*. 6 March 2018. Retrieved 8 August 2021.
5. **^** Han Jiapeng (韩佳鹏) (17 January 2020). 两桶油换帅：中石化董事长戴厚良调任中石油董事长. *163.com* (in Chinese). Retrieved 7 August 2021.

## External links[edit]

1. **Walmart**: Doug McMillon began his term as CEO in 2013.
2. **Amazon**: Andy Jassy began his term as CEO in 2021.
3. **State Grid**: I couldn't find specific information about the current CEO of State Grid. The search suggested similar articles, but none provided the required information.
4. **China National Petroleum**: Dai Houliang began his term as CEO in 2020.
5. **Sinopec**: I couldn't find specific information about the current CEO of Sinopec. The search suggested similar articles, but none provided the required information.

If you need more detailed information or further assistance, please let me know!

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
